discussion.content: First extend the data provider class - Then duplicate the report - Lastly extend the report controller class

comments.content:
This should be 1, 5, 2.
Step 5 is reffering to the newly created field, which is done in the step 1.
I agree that 2 is last but how should we define the order for 1 and 5? They are not dependent one from another... confusing
Logically, it is perfect.

Agree: 
Create an extension of the existing data provider class
Create a duplicate from the report
Create an extension of the existing report controller class
You don't need to extend the menu item since the controller class has been extended

discussion.content:
This whole question is particularly tricky.. There is really no given order for the actions, plus the solution is not even complete.

Correct answer are indeed steps 1, 5, 2, however the order is speculative. You can exchange these steps however you like and as long as you do all of them, it will work. The question even misses one last step, which is creating a an extension for the menu item, that references the controller class (it must reference our controller extension class).. Plus in step 1 we should rename (best to add some suffix) the report, so we can distinguish it from the original one, so we can make the controller point to this duplicate.

However I would settle with following order:
1 (Duplicate report [+ rename it?] and add the desired field), 
5 (Extend the DP class, fill the value there),
2 (Extend the Controller class and make it point to our (duplicated) report)

Not sure the description corresponds to the possible answers. It is asking for "You need to create an extension of the in-memory table in a model and you add the new field to the extension".
So the first thing to do would be... create an extension of the table

1 (Duplicate report [+ rename it?] and add the desired field),
5 (Extend the DP class, fill the value of the " newly added " field there),
2 (Extend the Controller class and make it point to our (duplicated) report)

Create an extension of the existing data provider class
Create a duplicate from the report
Create an extension of the existing report controller class
2 should come after 5 so it could be 1 5 2 or 5 2 1 or 5 1 2

comments.content: Typing mistake : 2 should come after 1 so the order could be 1 5 2 or 5 1 2 or 1 2 5

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer. You create a key performance indicator (KPI) that will enable users to be able to see the total sales per region. You create a tile named SalesRegion and link the KPI to the tile.
You need to ensure that users can view this tile on a form in the user interface.
What should you do?

choices.A: Create an extension of the form that will contain the new tile and KPI. Add the tile to the extended form.
choices.B: Open the form that will contain the new tile. Add the tile to the form.
choices.C: Create a new workspace. Add the KPI to the workspace from the user interface.

comments.content:
A is the correct answer (workspace pages are after all forms):
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/build-workspaces-finance-operations/1-kpi
A is the correct answer because KPI will be added to the tile and then tile will be assigned to the Form

discussion.content: A seems right as you add KPIs to forms via a Tile

A is correct according to this https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/build-workspaces-finance-operations/1-kpi
To add the KPI to a workspace, follow these steps:

Right-click the project and select Add > New item.
Select User Interface > Tile.
Select Add.
Drag and drop the KPI from Solution explorer onto the tile in the Tile designer.
Save.
Create an extension of an existing workspace form or create a new workspace form. Ensure the solution model matches the workspace form model, otherwise you cannot make an extension of that form. Create an extension by right-clicking on the form in the AOT.
In the Designer, add a Tile button. You may need to change the pattern of the form to custom to do this.
Set the Tile property drop-down option to the KPI tile that you created.
Save all and build the solution.
The workspace will show the new KPI that was created. Select the KPI tile to view details.

Selected Answer: A
Highly ambiguous question, we have to make a lot of assumptions here in my opinion...

The question implies that the KPI and the tile were created using Visual Studio.

That would mean C is incorrect, since you can create a KPI from the SalesTable form and add is as a tile to a workspace using the user interface, but :
- you don't have to be a developer for that
- creating the KPI and the tile in advance (using visual studio) in Visual Studio wouldn't be necessary 

Answer B COULD be correct IF:
- we assume the form you are adding the tile to is a custom form that is part of a custom model you have access to 
- AND IF we assume that we're opening the form in Visual Studio designer and adding the tile there
Seems like a stretch to me...


A is the most likely answer here I believe, since it explicitly says to create an extension of an existing form (we would have to assume it is a workspace form) and add the tile there. So that implies by a developer using Visual Studio.
Correct answer is A

C is wrong, 
To add the KPI to a workspace, follow these steps:
Right-click the project (VS)and select Add > New item.
Select User Interface > Tile.
Select Add.

Read the question statement again. It says, You need to ensure that users can view this tile on a form in the user interface and tile with named SalesRegion is created and link the KPI to the tile. 
So correct answer is C

I would say B is the correct one
I think A is wrong, because the question didn't specify to add it to an existing form
Thats why B is correct
C is wrong because it says add the KPI to workspace from user interface, if it said add kpi to work space from visual studio or object designer it might have been correct
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/build-workspaces-finance-operations/5-exercise?ns-enrollment-type=LearningPath&ns-enrollment-id=learn-dynamics.build-dynamics-365-finance-operations

C is correct and they have tried to confuse. Workspace is also type of a form, and KPI are best place in a workspace based form. Also check the link which clearly tells that workspace is a form where various forms patterns are applied: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/user-interface/workspace-form-pattern

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are creating a Dynamics 365 Finance report. You cannot query the data for the report directly.
You must include parameters to specify data for the report.
You need to create the report.
What should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Data contract class -
A data contract class defines the parameters for a report that is bound to a report data provider (RDP) class. You can specify one or more groups of report parameters, the order of the groups, and the order in which the report parameters appear in a print dialog box.
Box 2: Report data provider class
Report data provider class ג€" processes business logic based on parameters and a query, and then returns the tables as a dataset for the report.

Box 3: DataContractAttribute -
DataContractAttribute ג€" This attribute is applied to an X++ class and specifies that the class can be used as a data contract (that it should be serialized).

Box 4: DataMemberAttribute -
DataMemberAttribute ג€" This attribute is applied to a parm (parameter) method on an X++ data contract class and specifies that the data member should be serialized.
Box 5: SRSReportParameterAttribute
You set the SRSReportParameterAttribute attribute to the data contract you created for the RDP class.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/how-to-use-a-report-data-provider-class-in-a-report

comments.content: Package deployment is not a "location". Deployment of a report can be done in "Solution explorer" (right clicking) and as a optional checkbox in "build models".
You can check "build reports" in "build models", not "deploy reports".

discussion.content: AD is correct, by building project report does not deploy

To deploy a new report in a development environment in Dynamics 365, you can do so from the following two locations:

A. Package deployment

You can create a deployment package that includes the report and deploy it to the development environment.
D. Solution Explorer

You can also deploy reports through the Solution Explorer in Visual Studio by adding the report to a solution and then deploying the solution to the desired environment.

Selected Answer: DE
"Package deployment" is not a location in the same sense as Solution Explorer or Application Explorer. It's a method or process for deploying artifacts, including reports, to various environments.

the answer:

D. Solution Explorer
E. Build Models options

when you right click on report or project then you will see the deploy report option.as the questions says new report which is added in project.there is no relation with package deployment.

You have not clarified your statement of B being a correct answer. B is NOT correct. As mentioned multiple times, you cannot deploy a report by building a project. You must, as you've stated, deploy it by clicking "deploy report" option in menu, that you invoke by right clicking either on the report or by right clicking on the project the report is in (both in solution explorer)..
The Deploy report menu will only be visible when you have at least one report in project on build project menu

On the Build menu, click Deploy <report project name>. Alternatively, in Solution Explorer, right-click the report project and then click Deploy. You can view the status of the publishing process in the Output window.
